item.title: Kernel Density Estimation from Scratch
item.description: Motivation Why am I writing about KDE’s? At the recommendation of Will Kurt’s probability blog I’ve been reading a great book by Phillip K. Jannert: This book has a great overview of KDE’s that explain the motivation. My own abbreviated version is that KDE’s are a visualization technique to view a variables distribution. It’s best to visualize a variable prior to calculating measures of central tendency (means/modes/medians) and other statistics like variance and standard deviation.
